channel.title: Draggablity/dragable content
channel.description:
I was wondering if php had a way of doing this, i know that ajax and javascript can but im really trying to keep it just to php.
i know mopar's old index page had this with movable navigation, im looking for the exact same thing. example: page loads bunch of content boxes appear, you can move them-anywhere on the page, on top or below another box- (and possibly close or click links to open new ones)
1. what is this feature called/its proper name 2. any guides? code/tutorials/hints to approaching this?

item.title: Draggablity/dragable content
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:9, topic:337392”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=433795.msg3185457#msg3185457 date=1271691570]
ajax is part of javascript
[/quote]
a part which is completely unnecessary for making a draggable UI

jQuery UI is the way to go for this.[/quote]Very true… Weird. I didn’t think about how ridiculous the ajax option was.

Read full topic

item.title: Draggablity/dragable content
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

la­wl:

ajax is part of javascript

a part which is completely unnecessary for making a draggable UI

jQuery UI is the way to go for this.

Read full topic

item.description:
@lawl wrote:

ajax is part of javascript

item.title: Draggablity/dragable content
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

jQuery’s drag functions work amazingly well. I’ve made a few in my time…

item.title: Draggablity/dragable content
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

you only need javascript, not ajax or php
http://jqueryui.com/demos/draggable/
that looks good. i remember moparisthebest’s old one could be a bit buggy sometimes.

Read full topic

item.title: Draggablity/dragable content
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

I guess its possible… You’d have to read the click, then reload the page constantly with updated positions, it’d be far from reasonable…

Read full topic

item.title: Draggablity/dragable content
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

not possible without javascript

do it on an html5 canvas for extra credit
